TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit VerificationAttribute extends System.Attribute

Docs.summary: Defines the metadata attribute of a Web content accessibility rule. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format:
## Remarks An instance of the VerificationAttribute class defines a Web content accessibility rule that can be verified. For more information on Web Content Accessibility Guidelines, see the [World Wide Web Consortium (W3C) Web site](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=37125).
The minimal amount of information required to define an instance of a VerificationAttribute includes:
- A guideline that the verification rule represents. The value specified in the constructor sets the <xref:System.Web.UI.VerificationAttribute.Guideline%2A> property.
- A checkpoint of the guideline. The value specified in the constructor sets the <xref:System.Web.UI.VerificationAttribute.Checkpoint%2A> property.
- A checkpoint priority. The value specified in the constructor sets the <xref:System.Web.UI.VerificationAttribute.Priority%2A> property.
- A <xref:System.Web.UI.VerificationReportLevel> enumeration value that represents the reporting level that should be rule belongs to. The value specified in the constructor sets the <xref:System.Web.UI.VerificationAttribute.VerificationReportLevel%2A> property.
- A message that is reported when the verification rule is true. The value specified in the constructor sets the <xref:System.Web.UI.VerificationAttribute.Message%2A> property.
Optional properties of the verification rule that can be specified when creating an instance:
- A <xref:System.Web.UI.VerificationRule> enumeration value that represents how the verification rule should be interpreted. The value specified in the constructor sets the <xref:System.Web.UI.VerificationAttribute.VerificationRule%2A> property.
- A <xref:System.Web.UI.VerificationConditionalOperator> enumeration value that represents the operator in the conditional expression used to test the verification rule. The value specified in the constructor sets the <xref:System.Web.UI.VerificationAttribute.VerificationConditionalOperator%2A> property.
- An accessibility reference guideline URL. The value specified in the constructor sets the <xref:System.Web.UI.VerificationAttribute.GuidelineUrl%2A> property.
- A conditional value representing the right side of a conditional expression. The value specified in the constructor sets the <xref:System.Web.UI.VerificationAttribute.ConditionalValue%2A> property.
- A conditional property representing the left side of a conditional expression. The value specified in the constructor sets the <xref:System.Web.UI.VerificationAttribute.ConditionalProperty%2A> property.
The VerificationAttribute metadata can be defined class, property, and indexer declarations.
For more information about using attributes, see [Attributes](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
## Examples The following code example demonstrates using the VerificationAttribute class. In the verification metadata definition, the guidelines used are "WCAG," the Web Content Accessibility Guideline, and "ADA," Americans with Disabilities Act Guidelines. For more information, see the [World Wide Web Consortium (W3C) Web site](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=37125).
The checkpoints used are "1.1" and "1194.22(a)" for WCAG and ADA, respectively, checkpoints for ensuring that a text equivalent exists for non-text elements. The VerificationAttribute is applied to the `ImageText` property that represents the text equivalent of another property called `ImageProperty`. If the `ImageText` property is not set, the accessibility verification will return the message "The image is missing a text equivalent."
[!code-vb[System.Web.UI.VerificationAttribute#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/t-system.web.ui.verifica_1.vb)] [!code-cs[System.Web.UI.VerificationAttribute#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-system.web.ui.verifica_1.cs)]

MemberSignature.Value: public VerificationAttribute (string guideline, string checkpoint, System.Web.UI.VerificationReportLevel reportLevel, int priority, string message);

.method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(string guideline, string checkpoint, valuetype System.Web.UI.VerificationReportLevel reportLevel, int32 priority, string message) cil managed

Docs.param: The accessibility guideline the verification rule describes.
The message displayed when the verification rule is true.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with accessibility guideline, checkpoint, reporting level, checkpoint priority, and error message.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The VerificationAttribute constructor of the <xref:System.Web.UI.VerificationAttribute> class specifies the minimal amount of information needed to define a verification rule. The following default values for the <xref:System.Web.UI.VerificationAttribute> instance are assumed:
- The <xref:System.Web.UI.VerificationAttribute.VerificationRule%2A> property is set as <xref:System.Web.UI.VerificationRule>.
- The <xref:System.Web.UI.VerificationAttribute.VerificationConditionalOperator%2A> property is set as <xref:System.Web.UI.VerificationConditionalOperator>.
- The <xref:System.Web.UI.VerificationAttribute.GuidelineUrl%2A> property is set as an empty string ("").
- The <xref:System.Web.UI.VerificationAttribute.ConditionalValue%2A> property is set as an empty string ("").
- The <xref:System.Web.UI.VerificationAttribute.ConditionalProperty%2A> property is set as an empty string ("").
- To specify values of the properties in the preceding list beyond their default values, use the <xref:System.Web.UI.VerificationAttribute.%23ctor%2A> or <xref:System.Web.UI.VerificationAttribute.%23ctor%2A> constructor overloads.

MemberSignature.Value: public VerificationAttribute (string guideline, string checkpoint, System.Web.UI.VerificationReportLevel reportLevel, int priority, string message, System.Web.UI.VerificationRule rule, string conditionalProperty);

.method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(string guideline, string checkpoint, valuetype System.Web.UI.VerificationReportLevel reportLevel, int32 priority, string message, valuetype System.Web.UI.VerificationRule rule, string conditionalProperty) cil managed

Docs.param: The accessibility guideline the verification rule describes.
The message displayed when the verification rule is true.
The left side of a conditional expression used to verify the accessibility rule.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with accessibility guideline, checkpoint, reporting level, checkpoint priority, error message, .value, and related conditional property.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The `conditionalProperty` parameter is another property that is used as part of the conditional expression to evaluate the verification rule. For example, if the rule parameter is <xref:System.Web.UI.VerificationRule> then the related property specified by `conditionalProperty` must not be an empty string ("").
The following default values for the <xref:System.Web.UI.VerificationAttribute> instance are assumed:
- The <xref:System.Web.UI.VerificationAttribute.VerificationConditionalOperator%2A> property is set as <xref:System.Web.UI.VerificationConditionalOperator>.
- The <xref:System.Web.UI.VerificationAttribute.GuidelineUrl%2A> property is set as an empty string ("").
- The <xref:System.Web.UI.VerificationAttribute.ConditionalProperty%2A> property is set as an empty string ("").
To specify values of the properties in the preceding list beyond their default values, use the <xref:System.Web.UI.VerificationAttribute.%23ctor%2A> constructor overload.

MemberSignature.Value: public VerificationAttribute (string guideline, string checkpoint, System.Web.UI.VerificationReportLevel reportLevel, int priority, string message, System.Web.UI.VerificationRule rule, string conditionalProperty, System.Web.UI.VerificationConditionalOperator conditionalOperator, string conditionalValue, string guidelineUrl);

.method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(string guideline, string checkpoint, valuetype System.Web.UI.VerificationReportLevel reportLevel, int32 priority, string message, valuetype System.Web.UI.VerificationRule rule, string conditionalProperty, valuetype System.Web.UI.VerificationConditionalOperator conditionalOperator, string conditionalValue, string guidelineUrl) cil managed

Docs.param: The accessibility guideline the verification rule describes.
The message displayed when the verification rule is true.
The left side of a conditional expression used to verify the accessibility rule.
The right hand side of a conditional expression used to verify the accessibility rule.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with accessibility guideline, checkpoint, reporting level, checkpoint priority, error message, .value, related conditional property, a related conditional property value, and a reference guideline URL.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This VerificationAttribute allows you to create an instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.VerificationAttribute> class with all the possible properties specified.

Docs.summary: Gets the accessibility checkpoint reference in the specified <xref:System.Web.UI.VerificationAttribute.Guideline%2A> property.
Docs.value: A string representing the checkpoint reference.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The Checkpoint property is set when the <xref:System.Web.UI.VerificationAttribute> instance is created and is required.
For the Web Content Accessibility Guidelines defined on the [World Wide Web Consortium (W3C) Web site](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=37125) the Checkpoint property is specified as a guideline number followed by a period (.) followed by a checkpoint number.

Docs.summary: Gets the left side of a conditional expression used as part of the verification accessibility checkpoint.
Docs.value: The left side of the conditional expression. The default value is an empty string ("").

remarks.format:
## Remarks The ConditionalProperty property can be set when the <xref:System.Web.UI.VerificationAttribute> instance is created, but is optional. If you use a constructor that does not take a `conditionalProperty` parameter, the default value of an empty string ("") is used.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.VerificationAttribute.ConditionalValue%2A> property is the right side, or value, of a conditional expression that is use in the verification of the accessibility checkpoint. The left side of the conditional expression is specified with the ConditionalProperty.

Docs.summary: Gets the right side of a conditional expression used as part of the verification accessibility checkpoint.
Docs.value: The right side of a conditional expression. The default value is an empty string ("").

remarks.format:
## Remarks The ConditionalValue property can be set when the <xref:System.Web.UI.VerificationAttribute> instance is created, but is optional. If you use a constructor that does not take a `conditionalValue` parameter, the default value of an empty string ("") is used.
The ConditionalValue property is the right side, or value, of a conditional expression that is use in the verification of the accessibility checkpoint. The left side of the conditional expression is specified with the <xref:System.Web.UI.VerificationAttribute.ConditionalProperty%2A>.

Docs.summary: Gets the guideline that used for accessibility checking.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The Guideline property is set when the <xref:System.Web.UI.VerificationAttribute> instance is created and is required.
Examples of guidelines include "WCAG 1.1" and "ADA508".

Docs.summary: Gets the URL the can be used to get more information on the accessibility guidelines given in the <xref:System.Web.UI.VerificationAttribute.Guideline%2A> property.
Docs.value: The default value is an empty string ("").

remarks.format:
## Remarks The GuidelineUrl property can be set when the <xref:System.Web.UI.VerificationAttribute> instance is created, but is optional. If you use a constructor that does not take a `guidelineUrl` parameter, the default value of an empty string ("") is used.
The string entered for the GuidelineUrl property is not checked for correctness.

Docs.summary: Gets a message string when the accessibility checkpoint verification rule is true.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The Message property is set when the <xref:System.Web.UI.VerificationAttribute> instance is created and is required.

Docs.summary: Gets the priority of the accessibility checkpoint.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The Priority property defines the <xref:System.Web.UI.VerificationAttribute.Checkpoint%2A> property's impact on accessibility. Both the <xref:System.Web.UI.VerificationAttribute.Checkpoint%2A> and Priority property are set when the <xref:System.Web.UI.VerificationAttribute> instance is created and is required.

Docs.summary: Gets a enumeration value indication how the accessibility checkpoint is verified.
Docs.value: One of the enumeration values. The default value is .

remarks.format: ## Remarks The VerificationConditionalOperator property can be set when the <xref:System.Web.UI.VerificationAttribute> instance is created, but is optional. If you use a constructor that does not take a `conditionalOperator` parameter, the default value of <xref:System.Web.UI.VerificationConditionalOperator> is used.

Docs.summary: Gets a enumeration value indicating how the accessibility checkpoint is used.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The VerificationReportLevel property is set when the <xref:System.Web.UI.VerificationAttribute> instance is created and is required.

Docs.summary: Gets a enumeration value indicating how the accessibility checkpoint is used.
Docs.value: One of the enumeration values. The default value is .

remarks.format: ## Remarks The VerificationRule property can be set when the <xref:System.Web.UI.VerificationAttribute> instance is created, but is optional. If you use a constructor that does not take a `rule` parameter, the default value of <xref:System.Web.UI.VerificationRule> is used.
